newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Yields fall on Bulgaria 1-, 4-wk discount T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Yields fall on Bulgaria 1-, 4-wk discount T-bills.

text.p: Yields on Bulgaria's Finance Ministry one-week and four-week discount T-bills fell at the daily auctions on Friday, central bank figures show.
The average yields to maturity on the two issues were 0.47 and 3.77 percent, respectively, down from 0.50 and 3.83 percent on Thursday and 0.49 and 3.82 percent on Wednesday.
Bids were received for a total of 35.126 billion lev worth of T-bills as the one-week maturity was undersubscribed and four-week oversubscribed.
The ministry accepted all bids for one-week paper but rejected part of bids for the four-week.
The issues were offered with par values of eight billion levs and 28 billion levs, respectively and no minimum acceptable prices set in advance.
Details of the issues follow. Prices in percent of par:
Par value 8,000 million levs 28,000 million levs
Bids received 4,505 million levs 30,621.4 million levs
Avg price of bids 99.53 pct 96.37 pct
Bids approved 4,505 million levs 28,000 million levs
Avg yield to maturity 0.47 pct 3.77 pct
